title: Practical Computing Skills for Omics data
Untitled
text:
KEY TERMS













 Buffalo

 Book: Bioinformatics Data Skills (Buffalo 2015)











 CSB

 Book: Computing Skills for Biologists (Allesina & Wilmes 2019)











 git

 Software for version control











 Github

 A website that hosts git projects, which are known as repositories











 Markdown

 A simple text markup language (think LaTeX or HTML but much simpler)











 OSC

 The Ohio Supercomputer Center











 shell

 The Unix shell is a command-line interface to your operating system that runs within a terminal.
 There are several shell flavors, and in this course, we will be working with the bash shell.











 Nextflow

 Software for automated workflow (pipeline) management











 Slurm

 The compute job scheduling system used at the Ohio Supercomputer Center











 Unix

 A family of operating systems that includes Mac and Linux, but not Windows











 ADDITIONAL TERMS













 CLI

 Command-line Interface – a software interface with which one interacts by typing commands (cf. GUI)











 dir

 Short for “directory”, which is Unix-speak for a folder on your computer











 GUI

 Graphical User Interface – a visual software interface with which one interacts by clicking
